intro: Ixora eekhautii, commonly known as the Eekhautii flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Ixora eekhautii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
